key_points: A cargo ship, EverGreen, stuck in the Suez Canal is halting shipping traffic.
12% of global trade passes through the Suez Canal, causing significant disruption.
The blockage affects 10% of the global crude oil supply.
National average gas price is $2.86, with Illinois experiencing a higher average of $3.04.
Shipping delays and increased transportation costs may lead to higher consumer prices, including for gas.
Major shippers are rerouting ships south of Africa, adding to transport times and costs.
The strain on supply chains is exacerbated by prior disruptions from the pandemic.
National Retail Federation highlights the delay's impact on the supply chain and mitigation efforts.
Adil Ashiq (with MarineTraffic) and Denton Cinquegrana (OPIS Chief Oil Analyst) provide expert insights.
Efforts are underway to free the trapped cargo ship to alleviate the logistical and economic impacts.
